abstracts.cdata!:
The Yangzhou and Zhejiang Thermal Power
            Projects involve construction of large, coal-fired thermal
            power plants and expansion of related transmission networks,
            and represent a major expansion in the generating capacity
            of their respective provinces (about 15 percent in Jiangsu
            and 27 percent in Zhejiang). Partial credit guarantees were
            used for both projects. The partial credit guarantee covers
            a portion of a financing against all risks. This contrasts
            with the partial risk guarantee, which can cover up to the
            entire amount of a financing against specific risks. The
            guarantees were structured to extend the maturity of
            commercial loans and provide China with greater flexibility
            in accessing world financial markets, e.g., interest rate
            (fixed or floating) and currency (to match procurement
            contracts). At the same time, the Government and Bank wished
            to minimize their exposure under the guarantee. This report
            discusses the borrowing terms and guarantee structure for
            each project and their respective costs and benefits.
